founder_insight: Africaâ€™s most reliable location for true local AI inference. High latency to Europe makes offshore inference impractical for real-time workloads, forcing in-country or regional deployment despite high power OPEX.
Massive AI demand market where inference often runs offshore due to GPU scarcity and power instability. Acceptable latency to Europe makes hybrid or EU-hosted inference a common practical choice.
Strong connectivity hub for East Africa, but high latency to Europe and limited local GPU availability mean inference is typically routed to regional hubs, most often South Africa.

Mediterranean connectivity enables low-latency access to Europe, making hybrid or offshore inference viable. Local deployment is often shaped by data residency and state-led infrastructure priorities.
Extremely low latency to European cloud regions makes offshore inference the default choice. Local AI compute remains thin, with most production workloads running directly in EU regions.
Stable operating environment but limited AI compute depth. Inference workloads commonly rely on offshore European regions, with local infrastructure used mainly for routing and light workloads.
Policy-forward AI sandbox with minimal local inference capacity. High latency to Europe and limited compute mean inference is typically routed through regional hubs such as Kenya or South Africa.
